issues.title: Clinical Issues Extraction
issues.description: Used to identify distinct clinical issues from the transcript
issues.prompt:
Read the clinical scenario below
List the significant issues as brief, single-line statements. 
When multiple issues might be related by a clinical entity, combine them into one concise issue. 
Each issue must be 60 characters or fewer. 
Please ensure the list of issues isn't numbered.
Please ensure there isn't a trailing full stop at the end of each issue
Please only generate 2-3 issues for most patients.
For complex patients, perhaps 5 issues, for very complex patients 7. 
Use medical words where possible. 

Clinical Scenario:
{{text}}

guidelines.title: Guidelines Selection
guidelines.description: Used to select relevant guidelines for each clinical issue
guidelines.prompt:
Please identify ONLY the guidelines that DIRECTLY address the management of this specific clinical issue. 
The guidelines must contain specific recommendations or protocols for managing this exact condition.

Rules:
- Select ONLY guidelines the most relevant 1 or 2 guidelines that have this issue as their primary focus
- Return ONLY the exact filenames of relevant guidelines
- List each filename on a new line
- Do not add any additional text or explanations

Issue: {{text}}

Available guidelines:
{{guidelines}}
guidelines.system_prompt: You are a medical AI assistant helping to identify relevant clinical guidelines for specific medical issues.

clinicalNote.title: Clinical Note Generation
clinicalNote.description: Used to generate the final clinical note
clinicalNote.prompt:
Please write a concise clinical note using medical terminology, based solely on the clinical transcript provided below. Do not invent or assume any details that are not explicitly mentioned in the transcript.

The output should be in 3 sectiions.
The first section should be a simple summary of the presentation in bullet points, each point on a new line, including age, presenting complaint(s), and if relevant things like previous pregnancies (or lack thereof) and BMI. 
Then there should be a newline, then the middle section should be describe each issue in detail with the appropriate context and the associated advice from the doctor.
Then there should be a newline, then the plan: first write 'Plan:' and then, from a new line, a numbered list of the management steps anticipated

Rules:
- Use professional medical terminology.
- Use one sentence per line.
- Only include details that are directly mentioned in the transcript

Clinical transcript:
{{text}}

applyGuideline.title: Apply Guideline to Clinical Situation
applyGuideline.description: Used to apply a clinical guideline to a specific clinical situation
applyGuideline.prompt:
I would like you to apply the attached clinical guideline to the following clinical situation.

Your response should include the following, where appropriate:
1. Further information needed - list what additional information is needed and why
2. Proposed management according to the guideline
3. Benefits of the proposed approach
4. Risks of the proposed approach
5. Alternative approaches

Guideline:
{{guideline}}

Clinical situation:
{{situation}}

testTranscript.title: Test Transcript Generation
testTranscript.description: Used to generate fictional test transcripts for development and testing
testTranscript.prompt:
Create a fictional dictation of a clinical interaction between a healthcare professional and a patient. 
This dictation is for testing purposes only and should include various topics that might be discussed in a healthcare setting. 
Please ensure the material is entirely fictional and does not provide any real medical advice or information. 
Please ensure variables such as age, weight and history are varied.
The clinician should ensure the history and examination findings are incomplete, leaving out some pertinent questions.
In response to their history and examination findings, the clinician should  provide management advice and guidance.
The clinical scenario should be the following:

crossCheck.title: Cross-Check Clinical Note Against Guidelines
crossCheck.description: Used to validate a clinical note against provided guidelines
crossCheck.prompt: You are provided with the text of a clinical note from a patient encounter and a set of clinical guidelines with their content. Your task is to: 1. Cross-check the clinical note against each provided guideline and its content. 2. Identify areas in the clinical note that do not fully adhere to the guideline recommendations. 3. Note any parts of the note that could be improved based on the guidelines. 4. Return ONLY the HTML-formatted clinical note with the suggested changes. The clinical note should be output as valid HTML. Any text in the clinical note that has been adjusted or needs adjustment (in light of the guidelines) MUST be wrapped in tags (to display in italics). Immediately after each italicized change, include the guideline reference in parentheses (e.g., guideline name or identifier). When making recommendations: - Be specific and base all recommendations directly on the guideline content provided - Apply appropriate clinical judgment to ensure recommendations are medically sound - Consider the patient's specific circumstances as described in the note Very important formatting rules: - ALL changes MUST be wrapped in tags followed by the guideline reference - Make sure every single recommended change is properly marked with tags - Do not leave any changes unmarked - Do not use any other formatting except tags for changes DO NOT include any explanatory text, introduction, or conclusion in your response. DO NOT include the complete text of each guideline in your response. DO NOT use markdown or code formatting in your response. ONLY return the modified clinical note in HTML format, with no additional commentary. Here is the note text: {{text}} Here is each guideline with its title and content: {{guidelines}}

checkGuidelineRelevance.title: Check All Guidelines for Relevant Probability
checkGuidelineRelevance.description: Used to assess the probability of relevance for each guideline against a clinical note
checkGuidelineRelevance.prompt:
I would like to know which of these clinical guidelines are likely to be relevant to this clinical scenario.

IMPORTANT: You MUST use EXACTLY these probability levels for each guideline:
- Certain (directly applicable to the main clinical issues and patient's specific context)
- Highly Likely (closely related to the main clinical issues and patient's specific context)
- Likely (potentially relevant to secondary issues or patient's specific context)
- Unlikely (minimal relevance to the patient's specific context)
- Not Relevant (no clear connection to the patient's specific context)

Please analyze the clinical note and provide a response in EXACTLY this format:

### Most Relevant Guidelines
[List guidelines marked as 'Certain' or 'Highly Likely', ordered by relevance]

### Potentially Relevant Guidelines
[List guidelines marked as 'Likely', ordered by relevance]

### Less Relevant Guidelines
[List guidelines marked as 'Unlikely', ordered by relevance]

### Not Relevant Guidelines
[List guidelines marked as 'Not Relevant']

For each guideline, use EXACTLY this format:
Guideline Name - Probability of Relevance

Assessment Criteria:
1. Consider the patient's specific context (e.g., pregnancy status, age, comorbidities)
2. Focus on guidelines that provide actionable recommendations for the patient's current situation
3. Prioritize guidelines that address the primary clinical issues
4. Consider guidelines that may be relevant for secondary issues or future management
5. Be conservative in your assessment - only mark as 'Certain' if the guideline is directly applicable to the main clinical issues and patient's specific context

IMPORTANT FORMATTING RULES:
- Each guideline MUST be on a new line
- Each guideline MUST follow the format: 'Guideline Name - Probability of Relevance'
- The probability MUST be one of the five levels listed above
- ALL guidelines MUST be listed, even if not relevant
- Do not add any additional text or explanations

Clinical Note:
{{text}}

Available Guidelines:
{{guidelines}}

guidelineRecommendations.title: Analyze Note Against Guideline
guidelineRecommendations.description: Used to analyze a clinical note against a specific guideline and provide recommendations for improvement
guidelineRecommendations.prompt:
Please analyze the clinical note against the provided guideline and suggest improvements to better align with the guideline recommendations.

For each recommendation, specify:
1. The type of recommendation:
   - Additional information needed (history/examination/investigations)
   - Improved patient advice (options/statistics/patient information)
   - Different management plan
2. The specific recommendation
3. The reason for the recommendation (referencing the guideline)

Categorize each recommendation by importance:
- Very Important: Critical for patient safety or guideline compliance
- Somewhat Important: Significant for optimal care but not critical
- Less Important: Would improve care but not essential
- Unimportant: Minor suggestions that could be considered

Format the response as follows:

### Very Important Recommendations
[Type] - [Specific recommendation]
Reason: [Reference to guideline]

### Somewhat Important Recommendations
[Type] - [Specific recommendation]
Reason: [Reference to guideline]

### Less Important Recommendations
[Type] - [Specific recommendation]
Reason: [Reference to guideline]

### Unimportant Recommendations
[Type] - [Specific recommendation]
Reason: [Reference to guideline]

Clinical Note:
{{text}}

Guideline:
{{guideline}}
